sen.j: 頒暦商社（はんれきしょうしゃ）は、明治時代初期に本暦の発行を独占的に行っていた組織。
sen.e: Hanreki-shosha was an exclusive organization to distribute the calendar in the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）、文部省主導の下で江戸時代の暦師（弘暦者）を集めて組織された。
sen.e: In 1872 the Meiji government gathered the calendar distributors in the Edo period to form the exclusive organization under the leadership of the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 明治5年11月9日 (旧暦)に太陽暦改暦の詔が出され、頒暦商社は大きな損害を受けたが、代わりに明治6年から10年間の官暦出版の独占権を認められた。
sen.e: On November 9th of the same year, an imperial edict to change the prevailed lunar calendar to the solar calendar was issued, and the organization was significantly damaged by that, though later it was given a monopoly to publish the official calendar for a ten years, starting in 1873.

On December 9, 1872, an imperial edict was issued to change the prevailing lunar calendar to the solar calendar, and the organization was significantly damaged by that, though later it was given a monopoly to publish the official calendar for ten years, starting in 1873.
sen.cmt: 明治5年11月9日 (旧暦)→新暦だと1872年12月9日。"prevailed"→"prevailing"に修正。"for a ten years"→"a"を削除。
sen.e: On December 9, 1872, an imperial edict was issued to change the prevailing lunar calendar to the solar calendar, and the organization was significantly damaged by that, though later it was given a monopoly to publish the official calendar for ten years, starting in 1873.

sen.j: 明治16年にその期限が切れ、同時に版権が神宮司庁（伊勢神宮）に移されるとともに頒暦商社は「林組」に改組した。
sen.e: The Hanreki-shosha was reorganized into Hayashi-gumi in 1883 when the monopoly was ended and the copy right of the calendar was transferred to the Jingu Shicho (Ise Jungu) at the same time.

sen.j: 明治16、17年は神宮司庁より官暦の製造・頒布を委託されたが、明治18年より独自の暦を製造・頒布するようになった。
sen.e: Still it published and distributed the official calendar on consignment by the JIngu Shicho in 1883 and 1884, but from 1885 it published and distributed its own independent calendar.
